result.execSummary:
The defendant Herman E Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Fine of $100.00 including all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 11/14/16. Court orders penalty for non-payment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Herman E Hill

defendant.name: Hill, Herman E
defendant.address: 7029 West Silver Spring Drive Apt 4, Milwaukee, WI 53218

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petitioners Herman E Hill and Daven Davis in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, COURT DENIES THE PETITIONS FOR RETURN OF PROPERTY.

Return of property hearing at 12-23-2015 01:30 pm
Daven Davis

Return of property hearing at 12-23-2015 01:30 pm
(Herman Hill)

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction, with 2 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court also ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $100.00 INCLUDING all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 11/14/16.  Court orders penalty for nonpayment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Court ordered 12/16/15 jury trial date vacated.

Defendant Herman E Hill in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Herman E Hill in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for motion hearing.
Motion hearing proceeded.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, defendant's motion to dismiss for defective complaint and defendant's motion to dismiss alleging vagueness of the statutory scheme related to carrying a concealed weapon are DENIED by the court. Defense counsel requests jury trial date.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

-State's Brief In Opposition of Defendant's Motions To Dismiss For Statutory Vagueness And Defective Complaint from Assistant District Attorney Alex Mueller; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-From State of Wisconsin Department of Justice; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
From Defense, in support of defendant's motion to dismiss alleging vagueness of the statutory scheme related to carrying a concealed weapon.
From Defense, alleging vagueness of the statutory construction related to carrying a concealed weapon. Received and filed.
From Defense, in support of defendant's motion to dismiss for defective complaint; received and filed.
From Defense, for defective complaint; received and filed.

Defendant Herman E Hill in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37. State's response due 8/14/15.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Herman E Hill in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
